reviews.review: This game is one of, if not my favorite game of all time, and there is a good reason for it. This game took what half life 1 did, and improved on it in almost every way. For a game from 2004, the graphics hold up very well, with a world that feels like it could be a real place. The story in integrated very well in with the gameplay, with the only two cutscnenes where you don't have any control being at the very beginning and end. They achieve this by making all story elements happen in realtime with the game engine, which allows the player to remain in control for the duration of it. This leads me to the best part, the gameplay. This game has a pretty good range of weapons, with the player collecting their arsenal throughout the game. This allows for a LOT of creativity when trying to solve a problem. The most iconic weapon from this game, the gravity gun, makes this game very unique when compared to a lot of other shooters. It allows you to pickup and throw objects at the enemies, which allows for some hilarious interactions with the combine. I don't want to give any spoilers, but I just want to add the fact that the finale of this game is awesome, and it surprised me a lot with what they did to the gameplay with it. If you like shooters, but this game.
I remember watching my dad play Half Life, he loved it and passed that love of games onto me. Every time I play through this game, I feel connected to my dad in a whole new way.

The game is phenomenal for the time it came out. Whats great is the story is action packed and with some puzzles that just need common sense. The physics is also amazing to be honest if you want a good story game then this is it. And honestly you probably wont find a game like this its a 10/10 for me

I haven't played much (Actually I will edit this after spending a few hours in the game) but I tried it on GeForce NOW and it runs amazingly well, and had a good variety of mods that you can play on the steam workshop, the reason why I'm writing this review is not to show my experience, cuz I haven't played it that much.. but to give you a reason to buy HL2, as well as HL1 and the expansion packs. even if you don't like the main game, you can still play the thousands of mods, like getting half life 2, will get you a Netflix variety  of content. I recommend. 10/10

Stories of Gordon Freaking Freeman continues. This time, we are not a newbie scientist in Black Mesa Research Facility, but just a simple citizen of City 17, and of Earth.

If you liked Half-Life, then you better play this before the Combine starts a 7 Millisecond War in your home.
Story is great, characters are great (Do I even have to explain why Barney is the best character?) enemies are great...
...in terms of look and concept, maps are cool, music is amazing, you have a new companion (omg alex vanc!!1! femal charctre!!11!111! where bob???*0*??) and the best of all, atmosphere is astonishing.
We get to see our friends of old as well, which is neat. 
And don't make me talk about physics, ESPECIALLY the ragdoll physics.
The ragdoll physics that gave us the "funni tf2 ragdolls" but that's a different story that I keep for the future.

I could go on and on talking about my love for this game, and for the Source engine, but that'd make this review way too long.
Overall, Half-Life 2 was a fantastic experience.

If you have the money and feel interested in the series, go wild, buy this game.
And don't forget to get your free TVs!

Like Citizen Kane, Half-Life 2 has a story, characters, acting, sound effects, music, men, women, children, dramatic moments, funny moments and big robots that try to murder the protagonist. But what is Citizen Kane and Half-Life 2 really about you ask? The answer is simple. Family.

Half-Life 2 is a game I wish I had experienced in its prime, though is still an extremely enjoyable experience now. The storytelling is amazing, The physics are fun, and the shooting mechanics are simple yet enticing. Despite this, I still prefer the original game, as it has more replay value.
